abstracts.cdata!:
The loan would support the proposed
            Structural Adjustment Loan (SAL) to Costa Rica, which is
            being submitted concurrently.  Its purpose is to assist the
            Government in implementing the Structural Adjustment Program
            by providing essential information and analysis for
            decision-making in key areas.  It will further prepare
            specific action programs to achieve program objectives in
            key areas of the economy.  Specifically, the loan will
            finance about 230 man-months of consultant services to
            prepare studies or provide institutional support in several
            areas.  They include:  (a) improvement of budget preparation
            and management; (b) reshaping of CODESA's activities;
            (c) strengthening of public sector investment planning and
            macro-economic analysis; and (d) analysis of social security
            and health financing.  The project will also; (e) strengthen
            the policy framework in agriculture; (f) modernize the
            national banking system; (g) strengthen tax and customs
            administration; and (h) improve the cost-effectiveness of
            education expenditures.  Finally, the venture will involve;
            (i) analysis of salary structure and incentives in the
            public sector; and (j) analysis of tariff reform impact on
            industrial sub-sectors.
